abstract: Top stories from around the country.
snippet: Top stories from around the country.
lead_paragraph: Kashmir: An inquiry by an RTI activist found that the University of Kashmir has spent more than 2.16 crore Indian rupees, or 21.6 million (about $400,000), on vehicles for the university staff but has disbursed only 59 lakh rupees, or 5.9 million, towards student scholarships and fellowships in the last five years. The report said that 36 vehicles, mostly SUVs, were purchased, including a bulletproof car, which was bought for 9.25 lakh  rupees (about $20,000)(Kashmir Live).
